# The 2026 telecom shake-up: What's next for Vodafone India, Starlink, and your phone bill?

[**Jatin Grover**](https://www.livemint.com/authors/jatin-grover)

7 min read30 Dec 2025, 12:15 PM IST

![logo](https://www.livemint.com/lm-img/img/2025/12/18/600x338/2-0-138546681-Telecom-tower-4C-0_1681198113428_1766049004439.jpg)

Other important regulatory developments next year would be mandatory SIM binding in phones to use communication apps such as WhatsApp, Signal, Telegram, etc.

**NEW DELHI** : _Dear reader, as 2025, a year of global tumult and volatility, rolls by, Mint's reporters and columnists look around the corner on what is coming in 2026—to help you know what to expect and prepare for it. Tell us what you think at feedback@livemint.com._

As India’s telecom sector moves into 2026, the stage is set for major, high-stakes developments. Vodafone Idea Ltd will be under the spotlight, aiming for a turnaround with government support, while satellite broadband player Starlink is set to test new markets in the country.

The success of upcoming spectrum auctions, potential tariff hikes, and the execution of digital infrastructure projects by operators are also likely to significantly influence the sector starting next year, analysts said.
